entry.title: Understanding Your Partner Support Performance with the help of SAP for Me Reporting
entry.content:
The purpose of the Partner Support Performance report is to give transparent insight into how your partners interact with SAP Support on your behalf. It highlights key performance indicators that reflect support quality and efficiency. You can access it from SAP for Me in section Reporting or click here.

Notifications Section

The first section is a series of alerts focused on:

  • Consulting / Howâ€‘To Share

This explains how many cases fall outside SAP Supportâ€™s scope (for example, consulting questions or howâ€‘to requests). A high percentage may indicate knowledge gaps or a need for additional enablement.

  • Proper Use of Partner Sâ€‘User IDs

This section shows whether partners are using their own authorized Sâ€‘user IDs. Doing so ensures traceability, proper access control, and clean auditability.

  • Case Closing Behavior & Notifications

Here you see how partners handle the finalization of cases. Manual closure allows feedback and ensures the case was properly reviewed, while autoâ€‘closure might indicate unattended items.

  • Reâ€‘Open Rate

This helps identify if cases were previously closed without complete resolution or lacked details. High reâ€‘open rates can signal the need for better troubleshooting, clearer communication, or lack of attention to the case.

  • Processing Time

Processing time tracks how long partners respond or supply SAP with needed information. Faster responses usually lead to faster issue resolution.

  • Top Components & Trending Topics

This highlights components with high case volumes, helping to reveal recurring difficulties or topics where more training might be needed.

 After the alerts, the following   sections in the report give you a full, actionable picture of how partners contribute to the stability and efficiency of your SAP environmentâ€”both cloud and onâ€‘premise.

Summary Partnerâ€‘Created Cases

This section shows how many cases partners create on your behalf, their resolution rates, and how many of those cases are consulting/howâ€‘to in nature providing the following benefits:

Clear visibility of partner workload
You can quickly assess how actively each partner is supporting your landscape and where they are putting their effort (cloud or onâ€‘premise).

  • Improved partner accountability
    By seeing how many cases were resolved, reopened, or misâ€‘classified, you can better evaluate partner performance and maturity.
  • Ability to identify training gaps
    High consulting/howâ€‘to proportions signal areas where partners may need enablementâ€”helping you proactively address inefficiencies.
  • More informed resource and budgeting decisions
    Knowing which solutions generate the most partner-created cases helps prioritize investments in training, support, or tooling.

Details for Consulting/Howâ€‘To Cases

This section breaks down the nature of consulting-oriented cases, such as configuration questions, implementation requests, user-handling issues, or coding errors:

  • Rootâ€‘cause clarity
    You gain a detailed view of what is driving nonâ€‘supportâ€‘scope casesâ€”whether they stem from configuration, user handling, or development errors. This helps focus internal or partner improvement efforts.
  • Transparency on where effort is being spent
    Understanding partner tendencies (e.g., many howâ€‘to requests vs. genuine issues) helps ensure that Support from SAP is used appropriately and efficiently.
  • Reduction of preventable cases
    When you see recurring categoriesâ€”like improper user handlingâ€”you can address training internally or ask partners to reinforce best practices, reducing case volume over time.
  • Faster issue prevention and resolution
    With better insight into patterns, you can put corrective action in place before issues escalate or repeat.

Case Handling Practices

This section covers how cases are managed endâ€‘toâ€‘end: responsiveness, autoâ€‘closure, reopen rates, processing times, and priority distributions. The main advantages are:

  • Shorter resolution times
    When you know where delays occurâ€”slow partner responses, long processing time, high reopen ratesâ€”you can drive improvements that directly reduce downtime.
  • Better collaboration and communication
    Visibility into where cases stall helps you discuss expectations with partners and establish clearer communication routines.
  • Higher case quality
    Reduced autoâ€‘closures and lower re-open rates mean cleaner, well-documented cases that Support from SAP can resolve faster.
  • More predictable support performance
    Trends around reporter type, response behavior, and system roles help you anticipate where attention is needed and ensure smooth support operations.
  • Better control over critical issues
    Priority distribution insight ensures that urgent issues are being escalated correctly and treated with the right level of attention.

When you work with partners to manage or enhance your SAP landscape, you entrust them with handling incidents, questions, and howâ€‘to requests that keep your business running smoothly. The Partner Support Performance Report offers a clear, high-level look at how effectively your partners are supporting you, where things are going well, and where improvements might be needed.

We welcome your feedback and suggestions for further report automation and additional reports.

Please use the â€˜Feedbackâ€™ menu in the left edge of the page to share with us your feedback on this new tool and help us to improve the reporting functionality in SAP for Me.

Stay updated by subscribing to this blog and visiting the SAP Support Portal / Customer Insights.

SAP for Me is made for you!

Related blogs: SAP for Me goes reporting  or all related blogs to â€˜Customer Insightsâ€™ reporting dashboard.

entry.title: Fiori Elements List Report: Endless Loading Spinner on Scroll with ResponsiveTable
entry.content:
Dear Community,

The List Report initially loads the first batch correctly(30 records).

  • When scrolling to the bottom (or triggering "Load More" in growing mode), a new OData request is correctly triggered and the batch request succeeds (200 OK) and returns the next 30 records in the response payload (visible in Network tab â†’ response â†’ results / value array has data).
  • However:
    • No new rows appear in the UI table.
    • The loading indicator / busy spinner shows for a few seconds then stays endlessly (never hides).
    • Table remains stuck showing only the initial 30 records.
    • No console errors (or share if any appear, e.g., binding / virtualization warnings).

The autogenerated code corresponding to this requirement is manifest.json is as follows:

"controlConfiguration": {
                "@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem": {
                  "tableSettings": {
                    "type": "ResponsiveTable"
                  }
                }

 

What additional changes need to be made ? and changes should be done in manifest.json or do we need to add any additional annotations in the consumption view  ?

The note: https://me.sap.com/notes/0003607717 suggests the following solution, but not sure whether there is simpler solution.

  1. Use the setThreshold method in the sap.ui.table.Table class. This method allows to set the threshold to a large enough value so that instead of loading approximately 100 records, the desired amount of data is loaded.
  2. Use the FEv2 extension, onInit method to add a custom controller to the application. This custom controller can be used to get the table and set the "threshold" value.
  3. Ensure to include the custom controller in the manifest.json file.

Thank you!

Regards,

Karthik

entry.title: Re: No data released for my version and consolidation units
entry.content:
Hello SAP GR Aspirant,

After some analysis, testing and deep R&D, I was able to resolve the issue, and the data is now being successfully released and transferred from ACDOCA to ACDOCU.
Sharing with you the key checks and fix below in case it helps you facing a similar problem.

Prerequisites to Verify

  • Consolidation Unit is configured to read from Universal Journal (Universal Journal Integration active)

  • G/L Accounts are mapped to FS Items

  • Fiscal Year Variant is the same in Consolidation Unit (FI-Company Code) and Version

  • Currency is the same in Consolidation Unit and Version

  • Data exists in ACDOCA

  • Posting period of documents posted in ACDOCA matches the period selected in Set Parameters.

If All Above Are Correct

Check the posted documents in ACDOCA and verify whether the Consolidation Unit (CU) field is populated.

In my case, the CU was not appearing in ACDOCA. Because of this, the system could not pick up the data for release. As can be seen in the picture below.

Solution

Create a Substitution Rule in "Manage Substitution and Validation Rules" app to populate the Consolidation Unit in ACDOCA:

  • in Precondition select your Company Code

  • in Substitution

    • select your Consolidation Unit

    • Substitution Type: Substitute with Constant

    • Mark: Overwrite

Save and activate the rule.

After creating the substitution, post a new accounting document and confirm that the CU field is now populated in ACDOCA.

Once CU fields are populated, rerun Release Universal Journal task, and the data will be released successfully.

Hope this will you in case you face the same problem.

regards

entry.title: Discovering the Power of SAP Cloud Identity Services with SAP Fieldglass
entry.content:
SAP Cloud Identity Services (CIS) is a central cloud identity suite on Business Technology Platform (BTP) that helps companies to easily manage users on-boarding and application services.  

It offers comprehensive single sign-on and encryption across organizational and technical boundaries, but not only this. Itâ€™s comprised of a few different components, itâ€™s a broader application that covers more than just single sign-on into applications. 

Benefits to Using CIS 

SAP Cloud Identity Services offer several benefits for managing identities, authorizations, and Single Sign-On (SSO) across cloud and on-premise solutions. 

Key advantages include: 

  • Seamless Single Sign-On: Provides a unified SSO experience across systems using standards like SAML 2.0 and OpenID Connect, simplifying user access to multiple applications. 
  • Integration flexibility: Supports integration with both SAP and non-SAP systems, allowing for centralized user and group management. 
  • Data persistence and privacy: Provides a central repository for managing users and groups while ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations.

One of CIS's main features is the Identity Authentication Service (IAS). This feature focuses on providing secure user access to applications, and it offers a range of tools to enhance security, such as password policies, multi-factor authentication, and risk-based authentication. 

The Role of IAS 

IAS plays a crucial role in critical areas, which are: 

  1. User management:â€¯IAS efficiently manages user accounts and disseminates user data to various SAP cloud applications, including SAP Fieldglass. 
  2. Login management:â€¯Every time users access the SAP Fieldglass URL, they are directed to the SAP IAS. This service then verifies the userâ€™s identity either through single sign-on with the buyerâ€™s own identity management system or by using a username and password.   
  3. Authentication: IAS facilitates the authentication process, ensuring that users are who they claim to be. This can be done through various methods such as passwords, biometrics, or tokens. 
  4. Authorization: Beyond just authenticating users, IAS also manages authorization by controlling access to resources based on user roles, attributes, and policies. This ensures that users can only access what they are permitted to. 

Pre-requisites for IAS 

In order to use IAS, you first need: 

  • A BTP license 
  • Bundles (a group of pre-configured products and services that are sold together) 
  • Tenant Provisioning (SAP Fieldglass is automatically provisioned. This speeds up the entire process to get up and running) 

Subscribing to SAP Cloud Identity Services  

If you already have the SAP Fieldglass solution, you can start using SAP Cloud Identity Services at no extra cost by subscribing to it in the SAP Business Technology Platform. 

See Identity Authentication Services (IAS) for SAP Fieldglass to learn how to subscribe to CIS and add the SAP FG application to CIS. 

Integration  

SAP is continually integrating CIS into an increasing number of its applications. This integration is crucial as SAPâ€™s product suite evolves, ensuring centralized management of user profiles and streamlining the integration process with SAPâ€™s offerings. You need to have CIS in order to use the following features: 

  • Embedded Analytics and Analytics Add-on 
  • SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) 
  • SAP Task Center 
  • Joule 

By integrating CIS, you gain access to Joule's intelligent automation capabilities, simplifying access to information and automating business processes, thereby enhancing productivity. 

Joule uses Identity Authentication for user login and Identity Provisioning to manage user identities and their authorizations across various business applications. 

The Identity Provisioning helps you provision identities and their authorizations to various business applications. It enables customers to set up faster and more efficient administration of user onboarding and offboarding, and its benefits are:  

  • Automatic set up of user accounts and authorizations 
  • Optimized for SAP cloud applications 
  • The reuse of existing on-premise and cloud user stores 
  • Jointly working with the SAP Identity Management product  

Start Using CIS Today! 

Do not miss all the benefits you can get using SAP CIS! Itâ€™s not just a tool for identity management, itâ€™s a strategic asset that simplifies and enhances how you manage user profiles across your SAP cloud applications. By integrating CIS, you unlock numerous benefits, including cost-effectiveness, unified identity management, and simplified connectivity, ultimately leading to a more efficient and productive SAP environment. 

 

See Also 

What Are Cloud Identity Services 

Configuration SAP Fieldglass SSO with SAP Cloud Identity Services Identity

entry.title: Whatâ€™s New: SAP Integrated Product Development Update!
entry.content:
Welcome back to SAP IPD â€“ Whatâ€™s New! In this update, weâ€™ll highlight some of the latest enhancements in SAP Integrated Product Development, including improved engineering workflows and new integration touchpoints designed to drive efficiency and collaboration.

Common Functions

Managing Teams

Administrators can search teams by user. This enhancement streamlines team management, making it easier to locate and organize teams efficiently in the Manage Teams (New) app.

Formulation

Creating a Primary Output Specification within a Recipe

Product developers can now assign a product category when creating a primary output specification directly within a recipe. This helps with search and categorization.

Using Formulation APIs 

A new API is available for Formulation that enables users to create, read, and update recipes. The Formulation API also enables the user to read calculation data.

Specification Management 

Transfer of mapped attribute property data to new SAP S/4HANA specifications

Product developers can now transfer data values from SAP Integrated Product Development property fields to the mapped properties of a newly created specification in the SAP S/4HANA system. With this we extend the seemless integration between SAP Integrated Product Development and SAP S/4HANA.

Visualization

Importing a File

The Import dialog now includes a new Script option under Import Settings, allowing you to select and run configured scripts during file imports in the Browse application. It enables customers as an example to derive data from the CAD file and use those data to enrich product data in downstream processes. Overall this enhancement supports greater automation of visualizations.

To stay informed until the next update you can: 

  • Subscribe to the Whatâ€™s New Viewer on SAP Integrated Product Development Help Portal https://url.sap/5nbm4a 
  • Join our LinkedIn group SAP Solutions for PLM https://www.linkedin.com/groups/9257139/ 
  • Visit us at www.sap.com/IPD  

By the way, do you know how to provide feedback for SAP Integrated Product Development? Watch this video to find out how and send your feedback directly from the application. We always look forward to hearing from you.

entry.title: Practical SAPUI5 Form Validation: Name, Email & Password Fields
entry.content:
Introduction

Form validation plays a critical role in SAPUI5 applications. It ensures clean data entry, improves user experience, and adds an extra layer of security.

In this blog, In this article, we build a simple employee registration form that focuses on practical, real-world basic validation scenarios as follows:

  • Allow only alphabets in the Name field
  • Validate Email format as the user types
  • Block copy, cut, and paste for the Password field
  • Show clear, real-time validation feedback

If you are unfamiliar with regex, please refer to my previous article Understanding Regex in JavaScript - A Beginner-Friendly Guide for a better understanding before proceeding.

Let's discuss, along with the use case basic employee registration screen where data quality matters from the start:

  • Names should not contain numbers or special characters 
  • Email addresses must be structurally valid 
  • Passwords should be typed manually to avoid reuse or weak stored values 
  • Users should immediately know what is wrong and how to fix it

SAPUI5 provides built-in support for this through value states and event handling.

Form.view.xml
<mvc:View
  controllerName="demo.controller.Form"
  xmlns:mvc="sap.ui.core.mvc"
  xmlns="sap.m">

  <VBox class="sapUiSmallMargin">

    <Input
      id="nameInput"
      placeholder="Full Name (Alphabets only)"
      liveChange=".onNameChange" />

    <Input
      id="emailInput"
      placeholder="Email Address"
      liveChange=".onEmailChange" />

    <Input
      id="passwordInput"
      type="Password"
      placeholder="Password (Copy/Paste Disabled)"
      paste=".onPasteBlock"
      copy=".onCopyBlock"
      cut=".onCutBlock" />

    <Button text="Submit" press=".onSubmit" />
  </VBox>
</mvc:View>

Please Note: Using liveChange allows us to validate input as the user types, rather than waiting until submission.

 

Name Validation (Alphabets Only)

Names typically contain letters and spaces. A following simple regular expression helps enforce this rule.

Form.controller.js
onNameChange: function (oEvent) {
  var sValue = oEvent.getParameter("value");
  var oInput = oEvent.getSource();

  var oRegex = /^[A-Za-z ]+$/; //Alphabets Regex

  if (!oRegex.test(sValue)) {
    oInput.setValueState("Error");
    oInput.setValueStateText("Only alphabets are allowed.");
  } else {
    oInput.setValueState("None");
  }
},

//Accepted: John, Anna Marie
//Rejected: John123, Anna!

 

Email Validation (Structural Check)

Instead of allowing any string, we validate whether the email follows a basic, widely accepted format.

Form.controller.js
onEmailChange: function (oEvent) {
  var sValue = oEvent.getParameter("value");
  var oInput = oEvent.getSource();

  var oRegex = /^[^\s@]+@[^\s@]+\.[^\s@]+$/; //Email Regex

  if (!oRegex.test(sValue)) {
    oInput.setValueState("Error");
    oInput.setValueStateText("Invalid email format.");
  } else {
    oInput.setValueState("None");
  }
},

//Valid example: test@example.com
//Invalid example: test@, name@mail

Please Note: This doesnâ€™t verify whether the email exists, but it prevents clearly invalid entries early.

 

Password Security: Blocking Copy, Cut & Paste

For sensitive fields like passwords, allowing paste can lead to reused or insecure credentials. Here, we explicitly block copy, cut and paste actions.

Form.controller.js
onPasteBlock: function (oEvent) {
  oEvent.preventDefault();
  var oInput = oEvent.getSource();
  oInput.setValueState("Error");
  oInput.setValueStateText("Pasting is disabled for security reasons.");
},

onCopyBlock: function (oEvent) {
  oEvent.preventDefault();
},

onCutBlock: function (oEvent) {
  oEvent.preventDefault();
},

 

Final Submit Check

Before submission, we verify that no field is in an error state.

Form.controller.js
onSubmit: function () {
  var sNameInput = this.byId("nameInput");
  var sEmailInput = this.byId("emailInput");
  var sPasswordInput = this.byId("passwordInput");

  if (
    sNameInput.getValueState() === "Error" ||
    sEmailInput.getValueState() === "Error" ||
    sPasswordInput.getValueState() === "Error"
  ) {
    sap.m.MessageToast.show("Please fix the errors before submitting.");
    return;
  }

  sap.m.MessageToast.show("Form submitted successfully!");
},

This keeps the logic simple and ensures only valid data moves forward.

 

Conclusion:

With minimal code, we have achieved a clean and secure SAPUI5 form featuring:

  • Cleaner and more reliable user input
  • Immediate feedback using SAPUI5 value states
  • Better password handling for sensitive fields
  • A smoother and more professional user experience

This approach significantly improves data quality and user experience in SAPUI5 applications.

 

This is basic form validation using regex, but if you have alternative methods, improvements, or insights, please feel free to share them. I would love to learn from your experience too!

Thank you for taking the time to read this blog! If you found this helpful, i would love to hear your thoughts, feedback or questions in the comments. Let's keep learning and growing together!

Iâ€™m still new to blogging, so if you notice anything that could be improved or corrected, please donâ€™t hesitate to let me know.

entry.title: Re: default issuing storage location in purchase requisit...
entry.content:
Options in SAP Standard

Material Master â€“ MRP View
In the material master (MM02 â†’ MRP 2 view), you can maintain a default issuing storage location. When MRP generates a purchase requisition, it will propose this storage location automatically.

MRP Areas
Define MRP Areas in customizing (SPRO â†’ Production â†’ MRP â†’ Planning â†’ Define MRP Areas). Assign specific storage locations to an MRP Area. Maintain the material master for that MRP Area with the default storage location. This way, MRP runs separately for each storage location and proposes the correct one in the requisition.

Special Procurement Key
If the requirement is always an internal stock transfer (same plant, different storage locations), you can set up a special procurement key 45 for stock transfer. Assign this key in the material master â†’ MRP 2 view. MRP will then generate a stock transfer requisition with both issuing and receiving storage locations.

entry.title: Custom Integration Flows for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition integration with SAP IBP
entry.content:
Hello Community!

SAP has provided several standard integration flows in SAP Integration Suite (Cloud Integration) - such as Products, Plants and others as part of the SAP IBP - Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Package, documented here. 

However, when additional data needs to be integrated with SAP IBP, custom integration flows must be developed.

This blog walks through the process of create a simple, custom integration flow in SAP Integration suite to integrate data with SAP IBP.  As an example, it demonstrates how to integrate Work Center Header from S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to SAP Integrated Business Planning using SAP Integration Suite.

Prerequisites

  • You have activated the required business processes and set up the necessary communication arrangements in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system.
  • You have access to an SAP BTP Global Account and subaccount with an active subscription to SAP Integration Suite, including the Build Integration Scenarios capability.
  • You have preconfigured the SAP IBP â€“ Reusable Integration Flows within SAP Cloud Integration.
  • You possess a basic understanding of SAP Integration Suite and its components used to develop integration flows.
  • You have the username & password to access S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition

Detailed guide regarding setting up the necessary prerequisites is documented in SAP Help Portal.

Reusable Integration Flows

As described in the prerequisites, deploy the reusable preconfigured integration package SAP IBP - Reusable Integration Flow from Discover - Integrations Section as shown below.

Configuring Security Material

Before connecting to S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, a security material needs to be created in SAP Integration Suite which will be used by the adapters to communicate. You can configure the security material using the following steps.

  • Go to Monitor â†’ Integrations & APIs
  • Under Manage Security, click on the Security Material tile

  • Click on Create to create a new security material. We will be configuring the username, password to connect to the S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition.
  • Select User Credentials and provide the following details.
ParameterPurpose
NameThe name with which the security material will be referenced. The value provided here will be referenced in the integration flows.
Description 
UserUsername of the instance
PasswordPassword to authenticate the user

Procedure

Identification of the necessary API

Before you can build the integration flow, the necessary API and itâ€™s details will have to be identified.

  • Navigate to the Business Accelerator Hub.
  • Click on the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition as your product.
  • Click on APIs tab. Here you will see a list of packages, and APIs provided by SAP for interacting with S/4HANA Public.
  • Open the APIs tab, where youâ€™ll find a list of API packages and services provided by SAP for interacting with the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system.
  • Since our objective is to integrate Work Center Header, we will be using the corresponding ODATA V4 API, specifically the GET Work Center Header operation to retrieve all relevant entries.
    • API Reference: API Reference | Work Center | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

Creating the Integration Flow

SAP recommended naming conventions for artifacts developed using Integration Suite can be found here. They can act as a starting point to your development in SAP Integration Suite.

  • Navigate to Design â†’ Integrations and APIs â†’ Create a new Package.
  • Create a new integration flow artifact inside the package.
  • Click on Add and Open in Editor to open the GUI editor.

Building the integration flow

The integration flow is broken down into three, Local Integration Processes. They are created using Process â†’ Local Integration Process.

The following are the local integration processes will be built as we progress with the blog.

 

Local Integration Process NamePurpose
Transfer Data to IBPThis process is responsible to extract data from the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition API (OData) and load into IBP 
Create Batch in IBPBefore loading the actual data in IBP, a batch (data integration job) needs to be created
Post Processing in IBPThis job is responsible to trigger the IBP Post Processing (processing data from staging tables to the application tables) once the actual data load is complete.

These Local Integration Processes are then sequenced in a Main Integration Process which will trigger the subsequent process sequentially.

Transfer Data to IBP

  • Create a Local Integration Process
  • Add an External Call â†’ Request Reply and name it Extract Data from S/4
  • Add a Participant â†’ Receiver and name it S4HANA.
  • Connect the Request Reply with Receiver. Use the OData V4 adapter with the following connection configuration.
Address

<S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition URL> :443/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_work_center/srvd_a2x/sap/workcenter/0001

AuthenticationBasic
Credential NameName of the Security Material (created as part of the prerequisites)
CSRF ProtectedUncheck

  • Click on the Select button near the Resource Path. Use Remote connection source and ensure that the details are configured as per previous step.

  • Click on Step 2 button
  • Based on the API identified earlier, select the following.
OperationQuery (GET)
Select EntityWorkCenterHeader

 

Select only the necessary fields (columns) required for the integration as this will avoid unnecessary data fetch from the API.

 

Spoiler
You may also be able to filter necessary data in this step, but in this example, we are sending all the records from S/4HANA Public Cloud to IBP.

 

  • Click on the Finish button.
  • Add a new Mapping â†’ XSLT Mapping and connect the request reply to the XSLT mapping.
  • In your local device, create a new WorkCenterMapping.xsl file with the following code.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xsl:stylesheet version="3.0"
    xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform">
    <xsl:output method="xml" indent="yes" encoding="UTF-8" />

    <!-- Root template -->
    <xsl:template match="/">
        <IBPWriteMasterData
            MasterDataPrefix="A01"
            FieldList="RESID,RESDESCR"
            MasterDataType="RESOURCE"
            FileName="RESOURCE"
            BatchKey="WorkCenter">
            <xsl:for-each select="WorkCenterHeader/WorkCenterHeaderType">
                <item>
                    <RESID>
                        <xsl:value-of select="WorkCenterInternalID" />
                    </RESID>
                    <RESDESCR>
                        <xsl:value-of select="WorkCenterDesc" />
                     </RESDESCR>
                </item>
            </xsl:for-each>
        </IBPWriteMasterData>
    </xsl:template>
</xsl:stylesheet>

In the above example, ensure to remember the value provided for BatchKey as this will be used in the other integration processes.

  • Upload the XSL file in the XSLT Mapping Component.
  • Add an External Call â†’ Request Reply and name it Write data to IBP
  • Add a Participant â†’ Receiver and name it as IBP_Write_Data.
  • Connect the Request Reply with the Receiver with ProcessDirect adapter and with the connection address as SAP_IBP_Write_-_Post_Data.

Finally, the local integration process should like as follows.

Creating a batch in IBP

  • Create another local integration process and name it as Create IBP Batch.
  • Add Transformation â†’ Content Modifier.
  • Paste the following in the Message Body of the Content Modifier.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
<IBPWriteBatches>
    <IBPWriteBatch  
        Key="WorkCenter" 
        Name="Load Resource from S/4HANA Public Cloud - Integration Suite"
        Destination="<IBP System Name>"
        Command="INSERT_UPDATE"
        PlanningArea="<Planning_Area>"
        PlanningAreaVersion=""
        DetailedTrace=""
        ProcessUnchangedData="FALSE"
      />
</IBPWriteBatches>

Ensure to provide the Destination with your IBP system name and the correct planning area in the above code.

  • Add an External Call â†’ Request Reply and name it Create Batch in IBP
  • Add a Participant â†’ Receiver and name it as IBP_Create_Data.
  • Connect the Request Reply with the Receiver with ProcessDirect adapter and with the connection address as SAP_IBP_Write_-_Create_Batches.

Finally, the local integration process should like as follows.

Post Processing in IBP

  • Create another local integration process and name it as Post Processing in IBP.
  • Add Transformation â†’ Content Modifier.
  • Paste the following in the Message Body of the Content Modifier.
<IBPWriteBatches>
	<IBPWriteBatch 
           Command="INSERT_UPDATE"
           Destination="<IBP System Name>"
           Id="WorkCenter" 
           Index="1" 
           Key="WorkCenterInternalID" 
           Name="Load Resource from S/4HANA Public Cloud - Integration Suite" 
           PlanningArea="<Planning Area>"  
           ProcessUnchangedData="True"/>
</IBPWriteBatches>

 Provide the correct Destination and Planning Area. Also note that we have provided value of the Id attribute as WorkCenter, which is the BatchKey that we had defined earlier in our XSLT mapping. These values need to match, otherwise the data will not be loaded into IBP.

  • Add an External Call â†’ Request Reply and name it IBP Post Processing Call.
  • Add a Participant â†’ Receiver and name it as IBP_Post_Processing.
  • Connect the Request Reply with the Receiver with ProcessDirect adapter and with the connection address as SAP_IBP_Write_-_Process_Posted_Data.

The local integration process should look as follows.

Main Integration Process

Since our local integration processes are now created, we can trigger them sequentially. The Main Integration Process is already created when the integration flow was created, with the name Integration Process.

  • Remove the existing Start Message and add a timer component
  • Click on Call â†’ Local Call.
  • Perform this three times and sequence the components one after the other.
  • In the first local call, select the Create IBP Batch local integration process (under Processing tab)
  • In the second, select Transfer Data to IBP
  • In the third, select Post Process in IBP.

Your main integration process should look as follows.

Conclusion

The final integration flow should look as follows.

 

  • Once the integration flow is built, click on Save and then Deploy the integration flow.
  • Since we are using a timer event here, the integration flow will be executed as soon as it is deployed.
  • You can log into IBP and check the Data Integration Jobs app to see the status of the integration performed by the Integration Flow.

 

 

Using this approach, you may load any kind of data with some minor tweaks in the mappings (XSLT mapping, message body for batches and post processing).

Sources:

  • SAP Documentation on IBP Reusable Integration Flows
  • IBP Reusable Integration Flows in SAP Business Accelerator Hub

entry.title: Create an Editable ALV Grid with CRUD Functionality in ABAP
entry.content:
Objective

This program displays data from a custom table ZDB_SALES_CRUD in an editable ALV Grid. Based on user input, it allows creating new records, editing existing ones, and deleting selected entries from the table.

  1. Data Declarations

 

  • Declares the DB table from which we will retrieve and update data.

 

  • Defines a structure TY_VBAK_ALV that mirrors the structure of ZDB_SALES_CRUD. This is used for internal data handling.

 

Declares global data:

  • GT_DATA: Internal table for ALV display.
  • GS_DATA: Work area for processing one record at a time.
  • GT_FIELDCAT: ALV field catalog table.
  • GR_ALV_GRID: ALV Grid instance.
  • GV_OK_CODE: Captures user commands.

ðŸ–¥ï¸ 2. Selection Screen

 

  • Provides a simple UI for the user to choose between display or edit mode.

â–¶ï¸3. Program Execution Starts

 

  • Fetches data using GET_DATA and navigates to screen 100 which contains the ALV Grid.

ðŸ§© 4. Screen 100 â€“ Module Pool

Module: STATUS_0100 (OUTPUT)

 

  • Sets the GUI status (menu buttons like Create, Update, etc.)

 

  • Instantiates the ALV Grid object.

 

  • Builds the field catalog and populates the grid for the first time.

 

  • Makes the grid editable if user chose "Edit" mode.

 

  • Handles user interactions and maps them to specific FORM routines.

ðŸ“¥5. FORM: GET_DATA

  •  

    Fetches all records from the database table into the internal table GT_DATA.

ðŸ“Š6. FORM: BUILD_FIELDCATALOG

  • Dynamically builds the field catalog required by the ALV grid using a macro.

âœï¸7. FORM: ENABLE_EDITING

  • Enables edit mode on the ALV grid.

âž•8. FORM: CREATE_RECORD

  •  

    Notifies the user to fill in data and save.

ðŸ”„9. FORM: UPDATE_RECORDS

CALL METHOD GR_ALV_GRID->CHECK_CHANGED_DATA.SELECT * FROM ZDB_SALES_CRUD INTO TABLE LT_EXISTING.

  • Checks ALV for changes and fetches existing records from DB into a sorted table.

LOOP AT GT_DATA INTO GS_DATA.  READ TABLE LT_EXISTING ... WITH KEY VBELN POSNR.

  • Compares input data with existing DB entries based on key fields.

IF SY-SUBRC = 0.  UPDATE ZDB_SALES_CRUD FROM LS_EXISTING.ELSE.  INSERT ZDB_SALES_CRUD FROM LS_EXISTING.ENDIF.

  • Updates existing record or inserts a new one.

COMMIT WORK.REFRESH_TABLE_DISPLAY.MESSAGE 'Records updated in database.' TYPE 'S'.

  • Saves changes and refreshes the grid.

âŒ10. FORM: DELETE_RECORDS

CALL METHOD GR_ALV_GRID->GET_SELECTED_ROWS IMPORTING ET_INDEX_ROWS = LT_INDICES.

  • Gets user-selected rows for deletion.

LOOP AT LT_INDICES INTO LS_INDEX.  READ TABLE GT_DATA INTO GS_DATA INDEX LV_TABIX.  DELETE FROM ZDB_SALES_CRUD WHERE VBELN = ... AND POSNR = .

  • Deletes the record from the database and internal table.

COMMIT WORK.REFRESH_TABLE_DISPLAY.MESSAGE |{ LV_DELETED } record(s) deleted successfully.| TYPE 'S'.

  • Commits and informs the user of deleted rows.

CODE:

REPORT ZINSERT_SD_CUSTOM.

TABLES: ZDB_SALES_CRUD.

TYPES: BEGIN OF TY_VBAK_ALV,
         VBELN TYPE ZDB_SALES_CRUD-VBELN,
         POSNR TYPE ZDB_SALES_CRUD-POSNR,
         ERNAM TYPE ZDB_SALES_CRUD-ERNAM,
         AUART TYPE ZDB_SALES_CRUD-AUART,
         VKORG TYPE ZDB_SALES_CRUD-VKORG,
         MATNR TYPE ZDB_SALES_CRUD-MATNR,
         ARKTX TYPE ZDB_SALES_CRUD-ARKTX,
         WAERK TYPE ZDB_SALES_CRUD-WAERK,
       END OF TY_VBAK_ALV.

DATA: GT_DATA     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF TY_VBAK_ALV,
      GS_DATA     TYPE TY_VBAK_ALV,
      GT_FIELDCAT TYPE LVC_T_FCAT,
      GS_FIELDCAT TYPE LVC_S_FCAT,
      GR_ALV_GRID TYPE REF TO CL_GUI_ALV_GRID,
      GV_OK_CODE  TYPE SY-UCOMM.


SELECTION-SCREEN BEGIN OF BLOCK B1 WITH FRAME TITLE TEXT-002.

  PARAMETERS: P_DISP RADIOBUTTON GROUP GRP1 DEFAULT 'X',
              P_EDIT RADIOBUTTON GROUP GRP1.

SELECTION-SCREEN END OF BLOCK B1.

START-OF-SELECTION.
  PERFORM GET_DATA.
  CALL SCREEN 100.
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
MODULE STATUS_0100 OUTPUT.
  SET PF-STATUS 'ZALV_STATUS'.
  IF GR_ALV_GRID IS INITIAL.
    CREATE OBJECT GR_ALV_GRID
      EXPORTING
        I_PARENT = CL_GUI_CONTAINER=>SCREEN0.
    PERFORM BUILD_FIELDCATALOG.
    CALL METHOD GR_ALV_GRID->SET_TABLE_FOR_FIRST_DISPLAY
      EXPORTING
        IS_LAYOUT       = VALUE LVC_S_LAYO( EDIT = ABAP_TRUE )
      CHANGING
        IT_OUTTAB       = GT_DATA
        IT_FIELDCATALOG = GT_FIELDCAT.
    IF P_EDIT = 'X'.
      CALL METHOD GR_ALV_GRID->SET_READY_FOR_INPUT
        EXPORTING
          I_READY_FOR_INPUT = 1.
    ENDIF.
  ENDIF.
ENDMODULE.
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
MODULE USER_COMMAND_0100 INPUT.
  GV_OK_CODE = SY-UCOMM.
  CASE GV_OK_CODE.
    WHEN 'CREATE'.
      PERFORM CREATE_RECORD.
    WHEN 'EDIT'.
      PERFORM ENABLE_EDITING.
    WHEN 'UPDATE'.
      PERFORM UPDATE_RECORDS.
    WHEN 'DELETE'.
      PERFORM DELETE_RECORDS.
    WHEN 'BACK' OR 'EXIT' OR 'CANCEL'.
      LEAVE PROGRAM.
  ENDCASE.
ENDMODULE.
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM GET_DATA.
  CLEAR GT_DATA.
  SELECT VBELN POSNR ERNAM AUART VKORG  MATNR ARKTX WAERK
    FROM ZDB_SALES_CRUD
    INTO TABLE GT_DATA.
ENDFORM.
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM BUILD_FIELDCATALOG.
  CLEAR GT_FIELDCAT.
  DEFINE ADD_FIELD.
    CLEAR gs_fieldcat.
    gs_fieldcat-fieldname = &1.
    gs_fieldcat-coltext   = &2.
    APPEND gs_fieldcat TO gt_fieldcat.
  END-OF-DEFINITION.

  ADD_FIELD 'VBELN'  'Sales Document'.
  ADD_FIELD 'POSNR'  'Item No'.
  ADD_FIELD 'ERNAM'  'Created By'.
  ADD_FIELD 'AUART'  'Sales Doc Type'.
  ADD_FIELD 'VKORG'  'Sales Org'.
  ADD_FIELD 'MATNR'  'Material'.
  ADD_FIELD 'ARKTX'  'Description'.
  ADD_FIELD 'WAERK'  'Currency'.
ENDFORM.
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM ENABLE_EDITING.
  CALL METHOD GR_ALV_GRID->SET_READY_FOR_INPUT
    EXPORTING
      I_READY_FOR_INPUT = 1.
ENDFORM.
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM CREATE_RECORD.
  DATA: LS_NEW TYPE TY_VBAK_ALV.
  CLEAR LS_NEW.
  APPEND LS_NEW TO GT_DATA.
  CALL METHOD GR_ALV_GRID->REFRESH_TABLE_DISPLAY
    EXPORTING
      IS_STABLE = VALUE LVC_S_STBL( ROW = 'X' COL = 'X' ).
  CALL METHOD GR_ALV_GRID->SET_READY_FOR_INPUT
    EXPORTING
      I_READY_FOR_INPUT = 1.
  MESSAGE 'Enter new row data and press UPDATE.' TYPE 'S'.
ENDFORM.
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM UPDATE_RECORDS.
  CALL METHOD GR_ALV_GRID->CHECK_CHANGED_DATA.
  DATA: LT_EXISTING TYPE SORTED TABLE OF ZDB_SALES_CRUD
                        WITH UNIQUE KEY VBELN POSNR,
        LS_EXISTING TYPE ZDB_SALES_CRUD.
  " Fetch all existing records
  SELECT * FROM ZDB_SALES_CRUD INTO TABLE LT_EXISTING.
  LOOP AT GT_DATA INTO GS_DATA.
    READ TABLE LT_EXISTING INTO LS_EXISTING
         WITH KEY VBELN = GS_DATA-VBELN
                  POSNR = GS_DATA-POSNR.
    IF SY-SUBRC = 0.
      " Update existing
      MOVE-CORRESPONDING GS_DATA TO LS_EXISTING.
      UPDATE ZDB_SALES_CRUD FROM LS_EXISTING.
    ELSE.
      " Insert new
      MOVE-CORRESPONDING GS_DATA TO LS_EXISTING.
      INSERT ZDB_SALES_CRUD FROM LS_EXISTING.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.
  COMMIT WORK.
  PERFORM GET_DATA.
  CALL METHOD GR_ALV_GRID->REFRESH_TABLE_DISPLAY
    EXPORTING
      IS_STABLE = VALUE LVC_S_STBL( ROW = 'X' COL = 'X' ).
  MESSAGE 'Records updated in database.' TYPE 'S'.
ENDFORM.
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
FORM DELETE_RECORDS.
  DATA: LT_INDICES TYPE LVC_T_ROW,
        LS_INDEX   TYPE LVC_S_ROW,
        LV_TABIX   TYPE SY-TABIX,
        LV_DELETED TYPE I VALUE 0.
  CALL METHOD GR_ALV_GRID->GET_SELECTED_ROWS
    IMPORTING
      ET_INDEX_ROWS = LT_INDICES.
  SORT LT_INDICES BY INDEX DESCENDING.
  LOOP AT LT_INDICES INTO LS_INDEX.
    LV_TABIX = LS_INDEX-INDEX.
    READ TABLE GT_DATA INTO GS_DATA INDEX LV_TABIX.
    IF SY-SUBRC = 0.
      DELETE FROM ZDB_SALES_CRUD
        WHERE VBELN = _DATA-VBELN AND POSNR = _DATA-POSNR.
      IF SY-SUBRC = 0.
        DELETE GT_DATA INDEX LV_TABIX.
        LV_DELETED = LV_DELETED + 1.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.
  COMMIT WORK.
  CALL METHOD GR_ALV_GRID->REFRESH_TABLE_DISPLAY
    EXPORTING
      IS_STABLE = VALUE LVC_S_STBL( ROW = 'X' COL = 'X' ).
  IF LV_DELETED > 0.
    MESSAGE |{ LV_DELETED } record(s) deleted successfully.| TYPE 'S'.
  ELSE.
    MESSAGE 'No records were deleted. Please check keys.' TYPE 'I'.
  ENDIF.
ENDFORM.

entry.title: Re: New fixes and features in the Pipeline for Cloud Integration package with the Dec 2025 shipment
entry.content:
@muthukrishnanas thanks for your input, this is actually an issue of the design guidelines checks, sometimes they are too static or not flexible enough and hence end up in sort of false positives. As part of the publish process, we need to run the design guidelines checks and provide the report to the content reviewer incl our comments where the guidelines are not applicable, those comments however get lost when being published on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. In fact, the pipeline flows do comply to the design guidelines, as said where the report says it doesn't those are rather false positive. Like the one that you mention above, we do actually provide identifiers for an improved monitoring, this is also mentioned in the pipeline documentation, we fill SAP headers such as SAP_Sender, SAP_Receiver, SAP_MessageType, SAP_ApplicationID, furthermore we do support custom header properties. Another example for a false positive is wrt exception handling, we actually have defined exception subprocesses in all integration processes and local subprocesses, to reduce redundancy we defined a local subprocess for handling the exceptions which is reused in all exception subprocesses, this subprocess for sure can't have an exception subprocess otherwise it would call itself which doesn't make sense, the design guidelines however report this as non-compliant which is wrong. Another example is wrt externalized parameters. We actually use externalized parameters in the adapters as much as possible, like for the JMS queue names, for the receiver-specific JMS queue however we use an exchange property since this queue name is read from the Partner Directory, also this case is reported as non-compliant which is also wrong. We plan to feedback those flaws of the design guidelines to development, but it may be really hard to detect such situations.

Alex

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud - DRC - Custom Statutory Report
entry.content:
Good day @juan_gonzalez 

Thank you for your question.

Considering different frameworks generate the required documents, what you are experiencing is understandable. Legal Reporting uses Document Definition, while BP reporting uses Partner Correspondence. The fact that you are getting a blank PDF in BP Reporting means that the correspondence definition is not correctly assigned, even if the legal report PDF is correct. See Output Correspondence for some insights

Here is a quick guide you may consider for your system:

1. Verify you really assigned your custom Adobe form to Business Partner Reporting.

To do that, in the app

open your report definition (YY1_CERT_), then go to step 5.,

ensure the form you used for partner correspondence is your custom Adobe form and not a default or empty template. Save and publish the report definition.

If this step is missing or points to a different template, Business Partner Reporting can show a â€œblankâ€ PDF even when Legal Reporting is fine. See Correspondence Definition and Business Partner Correspondence for more details.

2. Check your mapping for the recipient which is your supplier/vendor mapping. In Define Statutory Reports Ã  corresponding Definition, confirm the recipient type is correct and confirm BP key passed from Business Partner Reporting is mapped to your parameter for example Vendor.

Note that if the correspondence framework cannot map the BP to your parameter, the form will not print any value even if it opens.

3. You need to confirm your correspondence query returns data from your BP run. Make sure your Query Definition (step 3) supports that selection:

  • Your query must return header data for the Vendor and period you select
  • If your query only works for the Legal Reporting layout, it may return nothing for the BP correspondence call.

4. Finally, you can then regenerate a new correspondence. To do that Open Run Statutory Reports, create a new run or regenerate items. Go to BP Reporting section and open the PDF again.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.content:
Hello, everyone!

I wanted to ask you about Mobile Services / Mobile Development Kit.

I'm having a problem uploading images because the limit is 10MB. What I did was compress the images from the frontend and then send them to the backend via odata, but the problem occurs before sending them to the backend. The frontend gives me an error that says the following: The request for the destination {destination name} exceeds the maximum size of 1048576 bytes and has been rejected.

entry.title: Re: entries of 2l and ol ledger difference
entry.content: Hi @jerrysam, if you want to post an adjustment via FI posting, you should post ledger specific and choose ledger group 2L, in order to not affect the other ledgers. If you go the direction of price change, you can change the prices in ledger 2L only which will trigger an FI posting only in this ledger. Best regards Marvin

entry.title: Re: Is it really only the sales order outbound process su...
entry.content:
Since SAP has explicitly documented in Note 3369482 that Advanced Shipping Request (Adv. SR) for decentralized EWM + TM is only supported for the sales order outbound process, I donâ€™t think this is just a phrasing issue. The restriction is intentional and reflects the current scope of supported integration.

That means outbound deliveries created against STOs are not covered by deliveryâ€‘based planning in this decentralized EWM + TM scenario as of today. If you need STO outbound deliveries to be integrated, it will require either a different process setup or waiting for SAP to extend the supported scope in a future release.

entry.title: SAP Note Not Available for My System Version
entry.content:
Hi community

We are applying notes for the reduction of Income Tax related to Brazil. The note in question is: 3705756 - Calculation of withholding tax in Brazil â€“ Calculation error in the accumulation amount of withholding income tax (IRRF) by type and withholding tax code

This note has the following prerequisites:

  • 3696029 - Calculation of withholding tax in Brazil - New customizing activity for reduction of the IRRF amount

entry.title: Re: Managing Invoices with SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management
entry.content:
Hello @AshishShahSAP,

Thanks for your kind words and reaching out here. Request you to refer this page detailing India specific configuration needed in CIM: CIM - India.

In summary, one needs to carry out following steps:

  • Configure Business Data Scope (CIM HomePage > Configure Business Data Scope) - To decide the Company Code to be used with CIM.
  • Field Control (CIM HomePage > Configure Business Data Scope > relevant Company Code > Field Control) - For the relevant Company Code (with Country India in your case), 'Field Control' needs to be configured to include local fields like GST Partner, Localized Reference Number (IRN), Section Code, etc.
  • Import Master Data from Fileâ€‹ (CIM HomePage > Import Master Data from File) - For the 'Connected System', Master Data of Types 'Business Place' and 'Section Code' needs to be uploaded using CSV files. For sample data with these 2 files, kindly refer Preparing Master Data Files for Import.

Hope it helps.

entry.title: Re: Research: Unmanaged Transactional Buffer For RESTful Application Programming Model
entry.content:
Hello Dmitrii, you make an absolutely valid point. Thank you for that.
You are correct that there is no necessity for double buffering if your API already handles it naturally. Moreover, it is best to avoid an unmanaged implementation whenever you can reduce complexity by using the managed type; otherwise, you risk significant boilerplate work for CRUD operations.
However, this approach is valuable when you need to provide transactional behavior to a data source that lacks it, especially when that source is complex (beyond database tables scenario, e.g involve requests to external service via http and etc.). The unmanaged implementation is quite opinionated. It doesn't offer a one-size-fits-all solution, but rather gives the developer the flexibility to design a buffer that fits their specific technical constraints.
Furthermore, this example serves as a great educational tool for developers to explore exactly how the unmanaged implementation works and how it differs from the managed one.

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA 2025: Key Innovations in Sales for the Cloud Private Edition
entry.content:
ðŸŒŸ SAP S/4HANA 2025 Key Innovations in Sales for cloud Private Edition

With the October 2025 release of SAP S/4HANA 2025 Cloud Private Edition, SAP continues to strengthen the Sales line of business through new capabilities that improve performance, automation, and process transparency.
After exploring the latest updates, Iâ€™ve summarized some of the highlights that deliver the most valueâ€”spanning Output Management, extensibility, order processing, returns management, and more.

ðŸ”ŽHow to Explore Whatâ€™s New in SAP S/4HANA Releases

If you want to compare innovations between releasesâ€”for example, from S/4HANA 2023 â†’ S/4HANA 2025â€”the SAP Help Portal and the What's New Viewer remain the most efficient way to explore updates by product, line of business, and topic.

ðŸ‘‰You can access the What's New Viewer What's New Viewer - SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition directly from the SAP Help Portal and filter by:

  • Product: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • Line of Business: Sales
  • Type: New or Changed
  • Version range: From your current release to a target release

This allows you to quickly identify innovations relevant to your business processes.

Key Sales Innovations in SAP S/4HANA 2025

â˜˜ï¸ Output Management Enhancements (NAST + Output Control)

One of the major improvements in S/4HANA 2025 is SAPâ€™s expanded support for Output Control in combination with legacy NASTâ€‘generated forms.

Preview NAST Forms in Fiori Apps

If you previously used NAST forms and later activated Output Management, you can now preview these legacy forms directly in Fiori, including:

ðŸ‘‰  Manage Billing Documents: Document Preview (F0797)

ðŸ‘‰  Manage Sales Orders Version 2: Document Preview (F3893) 

No additional configuration is requiredâ€”your existing NAST setup simply needs to remain active.

Here an example:

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide->Cross-Application Components->Output Control->Manage Application Object Type Activation

In Manage Sales Order â€“ Version 2 ( F3693 ) with a sales order that the form was generated by NAST:

You can preview the form: 

ðŸ’¡Business Value: More flexibility to Customer outputs forms.

 

â˜˜ï¸ New Flexibility for Global Trade Management

In Trading Contracts, you can now choose between:

ðŸ‘‰NAST

ðŸ‘‰SAP S/4HANA Output Control 

ðŸ‘‰Or both, at the contract type level

This gives organizations more flexibility during transitions between output frameworks.

New Output Management for Global Trade Management

By default, the message determination for trading contracts is still NAST so if you decide to use Output Control you should configure first the object type activation for:

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide->Cross-Application Components->Output Control->Manage Application Object Type Activation

And then you can choose by Trading Contract type which Output Control indicator prefer:

SAP Customizing Impl. Guide->Logistics â€“ General->Global Trade Management->Trading Contract->Define Trading Contract Types

ðŸ’¡Business Value: More features for Trading Contracts.

 

â˜˜ï¸ Import Sales Orders: Reference-Based Creation

A highly valuable enhancement: You can now create sales orders with reference to quotations or contracts using the Import Sales Orders app 

The imported spreadsheet now supports:

ðŸ‘‰Header reference data

ðŸ‘‰Item reference data

ðŸ‘‰Full or partial carry-over of preceding document information

The new template include:

ðŸ’¡Business Value: This reduces manual effort, improves data consistency, and accelerates end-to-end sales order creation.

 

â˜˜ï¸ New Extensibility: Sales Order API (A2X, OData V4)

SAP delivers a modernized and more efficient API Sales Order (A2X, OData V4) |built on the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP). It offers:

ðŸ‘‰Faster processing performance

ðŸ‘‰Asynchronous execution

ðŸ‘‰Ability to return minimal or full responses

ðŸ‘‰Full access to pricing details, including subtotals

ðŸ‘‰Enhanced filtering for sub-entities (items, partners, values, etc.)

This empowers developers to create more scalable and performant integrations.

To explore available APIs please follow this link: SAP Business Accelerator Hub

ðŸ’¡Business Value: Improves process performance

 

â˜˜ï¸ New CDS Views for Global Trade Management

S/4HANA 2025 introduces additional CDS Views for GTM supporting:

ðŸ‘‰Customer and supplier confirmation emails

ðŸ‘‰Header-level contract information

ðŸ‘‰Output parameter determination

ðŸ‘‰Value helps (organizational data, user IDs, contract types, etc.)

ðŸ’¡Business Value: These new views help streamline reporting, automation, and custom extensions. For more information, please see CDS Views for Global Trade Management | SAP Help Portal

 

â˜˜ï¸ Claims, Returns, and Refund Management

Iâ€™ve explored into Process Navigator - SAP for Me  into SAP Best Practices for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and the Customer Returns (BKP) process receives important updates in S/4Hana 2025.

ðŸ™Œ  Determine No Refund for Logistical Follow-Up Activity Receive into Plant

You have the option not to refund the customer when you select the logistical follow-up activity Receive into Plant (0001) in the returns order and later on  you can still create a credit memo request or a delivery free-of-charge with reference to the relevant returns order item.

ðŸ™Œ Automatic Inspection After Goods Receipt in Customer Returns

You can enter the inspection result when you create a returns order, before the product is returned. If you already know the inspection result before you receive the product and donâ€™t want to go through another inspection after it has been returned, you can ask the system to automatically create and complete the inspection using the inspection data and the next follow-up activity you provide when you create the returns order. As a result, after you receive the product, the system completes the inspection and triggers the specified subsequent logistic steps automatically.

ðŸ™ŒRefurbishment Using Maintenance Order as Follow-Up Activity

A maintenance order is created for returned products to initiate the refurbishment process. The maintenance order is configured as a refurbishment order.

ðŸ™ŒRefurbishment Using Production Order as Follow-Up Activity

A production order is created for returned products to initiate the refurbishment process. The production version specified for the production order must be a specific version that indicates refurbishment.

ðŸ™ŒQuality Notification as a Follow-Up Document

When saving a returns order, you can create a quality notification in quality management to trigger a parallel quality management process. The necessary settings for output management using output determination (SD-BF-OC) to create the quality notifications are already maintained.

ðŸ™ŒValuation with Reference to Preceding Sales Process

Traditionally, return deliveries are valuated based on current material valuation.
Now, S/4HANA 2025 allows you to reuse the valuation of the original outbound delivery, which is critical when:

ðŸ‘‰Sales context changed over time

ðŸ‘‰Historical valuation is required

ðŸ‘‰Margin or profitability analysis must stay accurate

This is enabled via a customizing switch and applied at the document level.

ðŸ“ŒNote: The checkbox into the Customer Return item level is currently not available in Fiori apps like Manage Customer Returns or Version 2.  It is accessible through the Create Sales Document transaction in SAP GUI, but donâ€™t worry is planned to include into â€œManage Customer Returns Version2â€ in the future.

ðŸ’¡Business Value: It streamlines the return process, resulting in better customer service, while also completing the product's journey internally or forwarding them to the supplier if necessary.

 

â˜˜ï¸ Joule: AI-Driven Sales Insights

SAP continues expanding Jouleâ€™s embedded AI capabilities. For Sales, new features include:

ðŸ‘‰Faster insights into the order fulfillment cycle

ðŸ‘‰Assistance with delivery and supply issue resolution

ðŸ‘‰Guided billing document creation

ðŸ‘‰Support to streamline the solution quotation process

ðŸ’¡Business Value: These capabilities help both sales and customer service teams act faster and with more context.

For Joule capabilities in detail, you can visit: Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition | SAP Help Portal

ðŸŽ¯Final Thoughts

SAP S/4HANA 2025 brings meaningful advancements to the Sales line of business by strengthening output flexibility, enhancing extensibility through RAP-based APIs, improving efficiency in order creation, and providing smarter returns process.
Combined with Jouleâ€™s growing AI insights, organizations gain more automation, transparency, and decision support than ever before.

 

I hope this was helpful for you ðŸ˜Š

I'm looking forward to your feedback and thoughts. You can post your questions in the SAP community, referring to this blog post.

Thank you,

Brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA RIG team.

entry.title: Re: BMH - 'Create Stock Transport' button with retail sites
entry.content:
Dear @MorganeleaB,

In Public Cloud for Retail a site is essentially the retail term for plant/location: Plant, Location = Site, so the way to make it work with sites is ensure your sites have the required plant + BP assignments that the app checks

More details below:

https://learning.sap.com/courses/exploring-sap-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition-retail/maintaining-sites-for-retail-3i3-

The Create Stock Transport Order button in Transfer Stock Cross Plant (F1957) is plant-based and SAP explicitly checks plant prerequisites customer/supplier assignment for the issuing plant and a default purchasing organization for the receiving plant

Summary:

If in your tenant/setup the Retail site is not represented as a plant usable in those SSCUIs or youâ€™re prevented from maintaining the plant shipping/purchasing-org assignments then F1957 one-click STO wonâ€™t activate because itâ€™s explicitly checking plant-based prerequisites like you saw in SAP Note below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/2891646

In that case the standard workaround is to create the STO (UB) via the purchasing apps instead of one-click in F1957. The BMH process itself is simply STO type UB between issuing/receiving plants

More details below:

https://learning.sap.com/courses/experiencing-supply-chain-business-scenarios-in-sap-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition/exploring-the-stock-transfer-without-delivery-bmh-scenario

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Re: Hide / Show dimensions on Tables and Charts in SAC in view / present mode
entry.content:
Hello @Raghav_S 

First and foremost - I absolutely apologize for such a late answer (was extremely busy during Q4/2025 and barely had a time for contribution in community blogs).

To your question. If you would like to have empty table initially (with no dimensions), first you would need to manually remove all dimensions rows in your table's structure on a design time. 

Then, you would need to modify initialization script, depicted in Step3, so that all elements (i.e. dimensions) in drop-down widget are populated as though they are all invisible from the beginning, in other words all they should have suffix (HIDDEN) in their name.

Since your table/chart won't have any dimension defined, you would need to populate them not from the table/chart, but manually.

Script in Step3 should look like below:

// reset global dimensions collections
while (actualDimensionIdTable.length) { actualDimensionIdTable.pop(); }  // dimensions id
while (actualDimensionDescTable.length) { actualDimensionDescTable.pop(); }  // dimensions description

// Manually populate Dimensions
var tableDimensionList = [
	"SALES_ORG", 
	"SALES_ORG_ID", 
	"PARTNER_ID", 
	"DELIVERY_STATUS"
];
// Manually populate Dimensions Description
var modelDimensionDescList = [
	"Sales Org (HIDDEN)",
	"Sales Org Id (HIDDEN)",
	"Partner Id (HIDDEN)",
	"Delivery Status (HIDDEN)"
];

// Create collections
for (i = 0; i < tableDimensionList.length; i++) {
	actualDimensionIdTable.push(tableDimensionList[i]);
	actualDimensionDescTable.push(modelDimensionDescList[i]);
}

// Populate Show/Hide dropdown list
for (var i = 0; i < actualDimensionIdTable.length; i++) {
	dropdownDimensionTable.addItem (
		actualDimensionDescTable[i]
	);
}

Note, all dimensions and their description above have to be named exactly how they are defined in your model.

Hope this helps out.

Best regards,

Slavek Kapitanec

entry.title: Re: API_PURCHASEORDER â€“ â€œDocument contains no itemsâ€ when...
entry.content:
Dear @dwix57,

That error is misleading in this case. With API_PURCHASEORDER_2 (OData V4) in Public Cloud SAP currently supports only:

  • PO type NB (Standard) and
  • customer PO types copied from NB (typically ZNB) with all dependent customizing

If you send another document type like NBF2 and even SAP-delivered variants like NB2/NBF2 the API can end up returning 06/010 Document contains no items although your JSON clearly contains items

SAPs Note below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3698875

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3555741

Proposal:

If you truly want a supplier Returns PO not an STO:

  • Use PurchaseOrderType = NB or a ZNB by copy of NB
  • Keep IsReturnsItem = true on the item
  • Do not send SupplyingPlant thatâ€™s STO semantics and often indicates youâ€™re trying to do a plant-to-plant process

Example:

{

  "PurchaseOrderType": "NB",

  "Supplier": "110001",

  "CompanyCode": "BMII",

  "PurchasingOrganization": "MGPO",

  "PurchasingGroup": "001",

  "DocumentCurrency": "PHP",

  "_PurchaseOrderItem": [

    {

      "Material": "10",

      "Plant": "02BP",

      "OrderQuantity": 5,

      "PurchaseOrderQuantityUnit": "PAC",

      "IsReturnsItem": true,

      "NetPriceAmount": 1,

      "NetPriceQuantity": 1,

      "OrderPriceUnit": "PAC"

    }

  ]

}

If you must differentiate returns POs by document type for downstream logic then create a custom PO type copied from NB (ZNB*) and use that in the API

Because youâ€™re using SupplyingPlant, this looks like an STO-style process even if your business labels it PO with supplier. The Purchase Order API is known to be restricted to NB/copies and historically not suitable for STO scenarios

SAP Note below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3110493

In Public Cloud, SAP provides a separate Stock Transport Order OData V4 API

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/bb9f1469daf04bd894ab2167f8132a1a/807b2c79e22c4ef7a4c30c928bb3344e.html

So if the real intent is store plant ->warehouse plant stock transfer, you should switch to that STO API rather than forcing it through API_PURCHASEORDER_2

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: Decommissioning solution manager
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We are in the process for migrating our sap system to S/4Hana public could . The project has already started .

Currently the solution manager 7.2  on our landscape is running on windows server and  with Oracle 12 C database . The database is already out of support .

We are not using any of the solution manager functionalities . And hence would like to decommission this solution manager system.

Could you please confirm if there is any issue or requirement from SAP to have it running ?

Given that the new S/4 HANA implementation is already in progress.

Thanks.

 




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Decommissioning solution manager
entry.content:
Hi Customer,

There is no mandatory SAP requirement to keep SAP Solution Manager 7.2 running for an SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition implementation.

For S/4HANA Cloud (public), SAPâ€™s recommended lifecycle management tool is SAP Cloud ALM. Solution Manager is not required to operate or support S/4HANA Cloud systems.

If Solution Manager is not being used (e.g. ChaRM, Test Management, Monitoring, Maintenance Planner) and there are no remaining dependencies from ECC or other SAP systems, it can be safely decommissioned.

Before decommissioning, please ensure:

  • No active SAP systems depend on Solution Manager

  • Any required historical data (audit/compliance) is archived or exported

Given that ECC systems will be decommissioned after the project, there is no SAP-mandated need to keep Solution Manager running.

If I can be of any further assistance to you regarding your query, please return this case to me for further analysis or else kindly confirm this case at your convenience.

if youâ€™re satisfied with the support received, I would appreciate it if you could take a moment to complete the short survey that will be sent after the case is closed. This survey specifically reflects your interaction with me and the support I provided. Your feedback is valuable to both SAP and myself, and it helps us improve our service.

Thank you again for your time and collaboration.

Kind Regards,
SAP Support
